how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;Task and project management (including CRMs);As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, my TiddlyWiki is for personal use only
putting it all together, what value does: It is note taking on steroids and I can custom build my task management and create structures for semantic data.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I have written custom HTML;I have written custom CSS styles
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Multi-file wiki served through Node.js;Single-file wiki with TiddlyDesktop
how do you back up/sync changes between: No automatic sync across my devices

outside of plugins, palettes and other i: I built my own task management system with HTML, CSS and filters and the help of community solutions to common problems. I made some slight modifications to the core plugins, mainly for rendering purposes.
what are we doing well? prompts for thin: The community is active and updates are fairly regular which helps to hold on to the learning curve and is a source of motivation.
what could we do better? prompts for thi:
Right now I don't see myself leave TW as there is no self hosted or "portable" equivalent: I'm not admin on my work computer and there is no other way for me to optimise my personal productivity.
I'm afraid that TW developpment might stop before it reaches a "perfect" or "close to perfect" maturity.
Unfortunately I do not have enough time to get more involved in the community and have no great developper skills to do so.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
